DataElement.preferredDefinition: Maximum spacing (distance) between cuts or exposures (slices) on a series of sequential medical images.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Maximim spacing (distance) between cuts or exposures (slices) on a series of sequential medical images.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tests that produce pictures of areas inside the body.:Slice; a thin flat piece cut off of some object.

Concepts.definition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.
A thin flat piece cut off of some object; anything resembling such an object.

Property.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Non-material physical anatomical entity of three dimensions, which is generated by morphogenetic or other physiologic processes; is surrounded by one or more anatomical structures; contains one or more body substances or anatomical structures. Examples: celom, thoracic cavity, lesser sac of peritoneum, cavity of right atrium, lumen of aorta, mediastinum, anterior compartment of forearm, intervertebral foramen.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.

Non-material physical anatomical entity of three dimensions, which is generated by morphogenetic or other physiologic processes; is surrounded by one or more anatomical structures; contains one or more body substances or anatomical structures. Examples: celom, thoracic cavity, lesser sac of peritoneum, cavity of right atrium, lumen of aorta, mediastinum, anterior compartment of forearm, intervertebral foramen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value number for an assessment of tumor marker.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default conceptual domain for all cancer treatment trials
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED WITHDRAWN to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Increased max length to match format.
